id="learning-about-classes-and-objects"><a class="anchor" href="#learning-about-classes-and-objects">#</a> Learning about Classes and Objects</h2> <p>A class is a blueprint consisting of an idea. Think of it like a data structure.</p> <blockquote> <p>EX. Creating a building, making a cake, registering students, gradebook, simpleInterest…..</p> </blockquote> <p>A class also is an Abstract Data Type.</p> <blockquote> <p>EX. <code>public Class Building ….</code> <br /> where Building becomes the datatype!</p> </blockquote> <p>Create a Building object (variable)</p> <figure class="highlight java"><figcaption data-lang="java"></figcaption><table><tr><td data-num="1"></td><td><pre><span class="token class-name">Building</span> stuartObj <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token keyword">new</span> <span class="token class-name">Building</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">;</span> <span class="token comment">// where stuartObj is of type Building</span></pre></td></tr><tr><td data-num="2"></td><td><pre></pre></td></tr><tr><td data-num="3"></td><td><pre><span class="token class-name">Building</span> lsObj <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token keyword">new</span> <span class="token class-name">Building</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">;</span> <span class="token comment">// where lsObj is of type Building</span></pre></td></tr></table></figure><blockquote> <p>Objects can be REPRESENTATIVES of the class.</p> </blockquote> <p>What kind of offerings does the class have for its objects??</p> <p>ENTER METHODS!! (METHODS ARE BEHAVIORS OF THE CLASS)</p> <p>ENTER ATTRIBUTES!! (DATA VALUES THAT AN INDIVIDUAL OBJECT HAVE OF THE CLASS)</p> <h1 id="lab"><a class="anchor" href="#lab">#</a> Lab</h1> <ul> <li>PROJECT<br /> Bank account simulator program</li> <li>Objective<br /> To write a program that performs various bank transactions.</li> </ul> <h2 id="project-description"><a class="anchor" href="#project-description">#</a> PROJECT DESCRIPTION</h2> <p>Bank of IIT has contacted you to write, compile and execute a complete program that creates bank account information and executes various transaction details for their clients.</p> <p>Your program will prompt users for options such as creating an initial balance, entering deposits or withdrawals. Also, your program will allow for the printing of account information including interest at various interest rates.</p> <p>Use any loops, user defined methods, conditional and relational logic and the basics of OOP to accomplish the objectives of this program.</p> <p><ins>Error trapping</ins> will be part of your grade so don’t forget to include some basic error trapping logic! Always comment your code thoroughly and include brief program descriptions as well where applicable for your source files for maximum points.</p> <h2 id="project-details"><a class="anchor" href="#project-details">#</a> Project Details</h2> <p>For this program you will create <strong>two</strong> separate Java files within your package, namely <code>AccountHolder</code> and <code>AccountHolderTest</code> .</p> <p>The <code>AccountHolder</code> file <ins>must</ins> include the following class field members and data methods to allow for transaction processing.</p> <table> <thead> <tr> <th>Field Name</th> <th>Field Type</th> </tr> </thead> <tbody> <tr> <td>annualInterestRate</td> <td>static / double</td> </tr> <tr> <td>balance</td> <td>double</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <table> <thead> <tr> <th>*Method Name</th> <th>Method (Instance)</th> <th>Argument</th> <th>Return Type</th> </tr> </thead> <tbody> <tr> <td>AccountHolder</td> <td>Constructor</td> <td>double</td> <td>none</td> </tr> <tr> <td>deposit</td> <td>Instance</td> <td>double</td> <td>void</td> </tr> <tr> <td>withdrawal</td> <td>Instance</td> <td>double</td> <td>void</td> </tr> <tr> <td>monthlyInterest</td> <td>Instance</td> <td>void</td> <td>void</td> </tr> <tr> <td>getBalance</td> <td>Instance</td> <td>void</td> <td>double</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <p>*assume all methods are declared as public</p> <p>Of course if you would like to add any extra fields or methods in your class(es) feel free<br /> to do so.</p> <p>Coding detail for your methods must include the following:</p> <ol> <li> <p>Allow the Constructor to accept an argument representing an initial balance for the Account holder. Set your balance member equal to the value passed in via the class constructor.<br /> <span class="red">Balances cannot start off negative! Include an error message if this is the situation.</span></p> </li> <li> <p>Define in your monthlyInterest method body, an assignment statement to update the account holders’ balance to be affected as follows:</p> <p><code>balance += balance * (annualInterestRate / 12.0);</code></p> </li> <li> <p>For your deposit &amp; withdrawal methods, either have your method body either increase or decrease the holder’s current balance accordingly.</p> <p>An added rule to follow here:</p> <p>Disallow the withdrawal account balance to drop below $50.</p> </li> <li> <p>Include comments on what your method is to perform (ex. any data to be received and what to return back to the calling environment).</p> </li> </ol> <p>For your AccountHolderTest file, include any local variables in your main method to work the application. Include the following transactional detail from your main method, to be executed in the following order for runtime needs. Run your program twice and follow details below and snapshot your results for each run. Label snapshots accordingly in your documentation.</p> <h3 id="snapshot-1-run-1"><a class="anchor" href="#snapshot-1-run-1">#</a> Snapshot 1 – run #1</h3> <ol> <li> <p>Create an AccountHolder object and prompt the user for an initial account balance and have the balance passed into the AccountHolder constructor.</p> </li> <li> <p>Allow the interest for the bank to be initially set at 4%. This can be hard coded in.</p> </li> <li> <p>Prompt the user to enter in a deposit amount.</p> </li> <li> <p>Prompt the user for a withdrawal amount. Show an example when a user enters a withdrawal that will drop their balance below $50. Display a message stating that a balance cannot go below $50.</p> </li> <li> <p>Display the ending or updated balance with included interest amount applied.</p> </li> </ol> <h3 id="snapshot-2-run-2"><a class="anchor" href="#snapshot-2-run-2">#</a> Snapshot 2 – run #2</h3> <ol> <li> <p>Prompt the user for an initial account balance. Include a negative starting balance<br /> entry and thus allow for a positive value only to be accepted.</p> </li> <li> <p>Allow the interest for the bank to be initially set at 4%. This can be hard coded in.</p> </li> <li> <p>Prompt the user to enter in a deposit amount.</p> </li> <li> <p>Prompt the user for a withdrawal amount.</p> </li> <li> <p>Display the ending or updated balance with included interest amount applied.</p> </li> </ol> <h2 id="objectives-general-tips"><a class="anchor" href="#objectives-general-tips">#</a> Objectives / General Tips</h2> <h3 id="uml-of-classes"><a class="anchor" href="#uml-of-classes">#</a> UML of classes</h3> <pre class="mermaid"><svg id="mermaid-1605292019743" width="100%" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" height="235" style="max-width: 208.390625px;" viewBox="-20 -20 208.390625 235"><g></g><defs><marker id="extensionStart" class="extension" refX="0" refY="7" Z"></path></marker></defs><defs><marker id="aggregationEnd" refX="19" refY="7" markerWidth="20" markerHeight="28" orient="auto"><path d="M 18,7 L9,13 L1,7 L9,1 Z"></path></marker></defs><defs><marker id="edge0" class="relation"></path></svg></pre><h3 id="accessing-data"><a class="anchor" href="#accessing-data">#</a> Accessing data</h3> <p>2 ways to access data</p> <ol> <li> <p>For static members (fields)<br /> <code>ClassName.staticmember</code></p> <p>Ex.</p> <figure class="highlight java"><figcaption data-lang="java"></figcaption><table><tr><td data-num="1"></td><td><pre><span class="token punctuation">;</span></pre></td></tr></table></figure></li> <li> <p>For instance members (fields)<br /> <code>objectName.method()</code></p> </li> </ol> <h3 id="the-constructor"><a class="anchor"
